Key Match Events: Sri Lanka won by 5 wickets with 18 balls remaining.
Sri Lanka chased the target of 122 runs, scoring 124/5 in 17 overs.
Pre-Game Insights: Opportunity for Babar Azam to get back among the runs after a string of low scores.
Both sides likely to rest key bowlers.
Sri Lanka defeated India in their previous match, after also having beaten Afghanistan.
Sri Lanka set a Sharjah ground record when they ran down 176 against Afghanistan.
Pakistan chased 182 against India with one ball to spare.
Sri Lanka also defeated India with one ball to spare soon after.
Pakistan's middle and lower orders collapsed against Afghanistan, leaving No. 10 Naseem Shah with the task of hitting big blows to get them across the line.
Pakistan have relied heavily on Mohammad Rizwan, who has 212 runs at an average of 70.66 in the tournament so far.
Sri Lanka's batting has clicked more recently, especially while chasing.
Babar Azam has been having a poor stretch this Asia Cup with 33 runs in four innings at a strike rate of 117.
Charith Asalanka has made 0, 1, 8, and 0 so far in the tournament.
Sri Lanka might swap Asitha Fernando for one of the younger quick bowlers Matheesha Pathirana or Pramod Madushan.
Sri Lanka might rest Wanindu Hasaranga and bring in Jeffrey Vandersay.
Pakistan may give Naseem Shah a break for Hasan Ali.
Shadab Khan might be rested, with Usman Qadir coming in.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dubai pitch is expected to favour the team batting second, with dew perhaps forming in the second innings to hamper the bowlers.
Sixteen of the last 18 matches in Dubai have been won by the chasing side.
Overall, Sri Lanka have lost 13 and won only eight T20Is against Pakistan.
Sri Lanka won the last three T20Is against Pakistan in 2019.
